trans-unit.source: Provides data for mouse button related events.

MouseButtonEventArgs is used with the following events: <xref:System.Windows.Input.Mouse.MouseDown>, <xref:System.Windows.Input.Mouse.MouseUp>, <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown>, <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp>, <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseRightButtonDown>, <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseRightButtonUp>, and the corresponding tunneling events.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.Mouse> class provides additional properties and methods for determining the state of the mouse.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseDevice"></xref>, timestamp, and <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButton"></xref>.
The logical Mouse device associated with this event.
The time when the input occurred.
The mouse button whose state is being described.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseDevice"></xref>, timestamp, <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButton"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice"></xref>.
The logical mouse device associated with this event.
The time the event occurred.
The button associated with this event.
The stylus device associated with this event.
Gets the state of the button associated with the event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.Mouse> class provides additional properties and methods for determining the state of the mouse.
The state the button is in.
Gets the button associated with the event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.Mouse> class provides additional properties and methods for determining the state of the mouse.
The button which was pressed.
Gets the number of times the button was clicked.
One use of ClickCount is to determine whether a double mouse click has occurred.
Some classes expose events for a double-click, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control.MouseDoubleClick> event on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control> class.
When a double click event is not exposed on a class, a double click can be detected by using the ClickCount property on the event data.
The number of times the mouse button was clicked.
Invokes event handlers in a type-specific way, which can increase event system efficiency.
This implementation casts the generic handler as a <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseEventHandler> and then invokes it.
For details on this implementation pattern and the reasons for it, see <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeEventHandler%2A> and [Routed Events Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The generic handler to call in a type-specific way.
The target to call the handler on.
